creator: colin@london.virgin.net
text:
I'm using a JSP as a central controller, and mapping URLs to it. It seems that
Tomcat is losing the URL originally supplied, and using the URL to the JSP page
instead - this shows in the access log, and getServletPath() is not returning
the value I expect.

I'm calling the URL:

http://localhost.localdomain:8080/myapp/mymapping?name=value

My web.xml looks like this:

<web-app>

  <servlet>
    <servlet-name>ResortGuideJSP</servlet-name>
    <jsp-file>jsp/main.jsp</jsp-file>
  </servlet>

  <servlet-mapping>
    <servlet-name>ResortGuideJSP</servlet-name>
    <url-pattern>/mymapping</url-pattern>
  </servlet-mapping>

</webapp>

And my access log looks like this:

182.101.24.108 - - [13/Jul/2001:13:13:15 00] "GET /myapp/jsp/main.jsp HTTP/1.1"
200 33484

This all worked fine in Tomcat 3.3M3, which I was using previously.

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text: Fixed in nightly build 20010717.  Will be fixed in Tomcat 4.0-beta-6 release.
